item.description:
New to Boston, long time away from Europe? Join and share your thoughts, not on facebook or twitter, not an a mailing list or on your  phone. Do it live at a Meetup.

We expressively welcome anybody who lived for a while in a German speaking country. See you on Wednesday!

Please do not forget to RSVP

 

Kaj

Your humble organizer

P.S.: Jacob Wirth is a German Restaurant in the theater district of Boston, that serves German favorites such as Bratwurst and Sauerkraut or Wiener Schnitzel. They also have Paulaner Hefeweizen and other German beer.

P.P.S.: There is parking right next to the restaurant, which is $20 (the deposit is NOT REFUNDED ANY MORE). If you like a walk in the Park, you can take advantage of the night special at the Boston Common parking for $11 flat. And off course with $4+ gas prices, the T-Stop is Orange Line - Tufts Medical Center
item.how_to_find_us: I'm usually the guy in a red Meetup T-Shirt.
item.why: I moved this one week earlier than usual, so it is not right before Thanksgiving. happy Turkey day everyone!
item.name: German Expatriates in Boston Meetup Monthly Meetup
